title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: vignette provides overview basic functions within Pandora Data package, allowing users explore retrieve information networks, repositories, file types, resources.

title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: show available networks use getNetworks() function:

title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: list available repositories use getRepositories() function. can filter output using network pattern arguments. instance, list repositories IsoMemo network:

title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: Use getFileTypes() function list available file types. following example showcases file types available ‘IsoMemo’ network:

what: Filter Resources by pattern or File Type
title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: list available resources, employ getResources() function. Filter output using network, repository, fileType, pattern arguments. instance, list CSV files whose meta information contains string plants:
code: resourcesPlants <- getResources(   fileType = c("csv"),   pattern = "plant"   )  resourcesPlants[c("name", "format")]  %>%    knitr::kable()

what: Get the data of a Specific Resource
title: How to use the Pandora Data Package
text: retrieve data specific resource, use getData() function. text files one can specify e.g. separator using helper function dataOptions(). example demonstrates fetching data "CIMA Humans 29.05.2021 CSV" resource:
code: isotopicData <- getData(   name = "CIMA Animals 29.05.2021 CSV",   options = dataOptions(sep = ";"))  #> Encoding: 'UTF-8'. isotopicData  %>%    head(5)  %>%    dplyr::select(c("Entry_ID", "General_Category_Family", "Common_Name", "Sampled_Element", "Analysed_Component")) %>%   knitr::kable()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Jan Abel. Maintainer. Antonia Runge. Author. Andreas Neudecker. Author. Ricardo Fernandes. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Runge , Neudecker , Fernandes R (2024). Pandora: Retrieve Data using API 'Pandora' Data Platform. R package version 24.2.0, https://pandora-isomemo.github.io/pandora-data/, https://github.com/Pandora-IsoMemo/pandora-data.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Pandora: Retrieve Data using the API of the 'Pandora' Data Platform},   author = {Antonia Runge and Andreas Neudecker and Ricardo Fernandes},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 24.2.0, https://pandora-isomemo.github.io/pandora-data/},   url = {https://github.com/Pandora-IsoMemo/pandora-data}, }

what: Retrieve Data using the API of the Pandora Data Platform
title: Retrieve Data using the API of the Pandora Data Platform
text: R-Package wrapper CKAN API Pandora data platform. Pandora seeks better understanding human story offering technological solutions make historical archaeological data accessible easily findable. grassroots initiative research communities across various academic disciplines self-curate datasets self-manage community membership roles.

title: Retrieve Data using the API of the Pandora Data Platform
text: can install released version Pandora CRAN : can install development version Pandora GitHub :

title: Retrieve Data using the API of the Pandora Data Platform
text: Refer vignette --use-pandora-data description basics function pandora data package.

title: Call API — callAPI
text: Call API

title: Call API — callAPI
text: action (character) name endpoint "mapping" ... parameters endpoint, e.g. all_fields = "true"

title: Call API — callAPI
text: (data.frame) output Pandora API

title: Data Options — dataOptions
text: Set options utils::read.csv(), openxlsx::read.xlsx() readxl::read_excel. Choose delimiter decimal separator well sheetnumbner number rows read.

title: Data Options — dataOptions
code: dataOptions(   nrows = NA_integer_,   colNames = TRUE,   sep = ",",   dec = ".",   fileEncoding = "",   sheet = 1 )

title: Data Options — dataOptions
text: nrows integer: maximum number rows read .  Negative     invalid values ignored. colNames TRUE, first row data used column names. sep field separator character.  Values line     file separated character.  sep = "" (    default read.table) separator ‘white space’,     one spaces, tabs, newlines carriage returns. dec character used file decimal points. fileEncoding character string: non-empty declares     encoding used file (connection) character data can     re-encoded.  See ‘Encoding’ section help     file, ‘R Data Import/Export’ manual     ‘Note’. sheet name index sheet read data .

title: Data Options — dataOptions
text: list extra options utils::read.csv() openxlsx::read.xlsx() readxl::read_excel, respectively

text: Search pattern columns datAPI filter respective rows

text: Filter Resource Name

title: Rename Repository Meta Columns — formatRepositoryList
text: Apply names 'Additional Info' box 'https://pandoradata.earth/dataset/' columns returned data

code: formatRepositoryList(   packageList,   columns = getDatasetFields(),   renameColumns = TRUE )

title: Rename Repository Meta Columns — formatRepositoryList
text: packageList (data.frame) optional, output callAPI() e.g. previous call Pandora API. columns (character) names columns returned renameColumns (logical) apply names 'Additional Info' box 'https://pandoradata.earth/dataset/' columns returned data

text: (data.frame) containing available repositories

title: Get Data — getData
text: Get Data

title: Get Data — getData
code: getData(name, repository = "", verbose = TRUE, options = dataOptions())

title: Get Data — getData
text: name (character) name resource, e.g. entry output getResources()$name repository (character) name Pandora repository, e.g. entry output getRepositories()$name verbose Logical, indicating whether display processing messages. TRUE, messages displayed; FALSE, messages suppressed. Default TRUE. options (list) list extra options read.csv() openxlsx::read.xlsx() readxl::read_excel

text: repository (character) name Pandora repository, e.g. entry output getRepositories()$name network (character) name Pandora network, e.g. entry output getNetworks()$name pattern (character) string meta information search order (logical) TRUE, order dataframe alphabetically 'repository' 'name' packageList (data.frame) optional, output callAPI() e.g. previous call Pandora API.

text: (data.frame) containing available file types within repository

text: network (character) name Pandora network, e.g. entry output getNetworks()$name pattern (character) string meta information search order (logical) TRUE, order dataframe alphabetically 'repository' 'name' columns (character) names columns returned renameColumns (logical) apply names 'Additional Info' box 'https://pandoradata.earth/dataset/' columns returned data packageList (data.frame) optional, output callAPI() e.g. previous call Pandora API.

title: Get Resources — getResources
text: fileType (character) list relevant file types, e.g. c("xls", "xlsx", "csv", "odt") repository (character) name Pandora repository, e.g. entry output getRepositories()$name network (character) name Pandora network, e.g. entry output getNetworks()$name pattern (character) string meta information search order (logical) TRUE, order dataframe alphabetically 'repository' 'name' packageList (data.frame) optional, output callAPI() e.g. previous call Pandora API.

text: (data.frame) containing available resources within repository

TRUE, messages displayed; FALSE, messages suppressed. Default TRUE.

title: Pandora 23.11.2
text: new function getData() added, enables data retrieval function dataOption() returns list options utils::read.csv() openxlsx::read.xlsx() readxl::read_excel, respectively, can passed getData()

text: export callAPI() function, update documentation

title: Pandora 23.11.0
text: main function facilitate data retrieval aggregation API : getData() (development) following sub-functions contained package: optional filtering names given string within specific network optional filtering meta information given string within specific network within specific repository optional filtering meta information given string filtered file type within specific network within specific repository optional filtering meta information given string
